name: Joseph LEE, Jr., Administrator of the Estate of Ethel M. Lee, Appellant, v. ALLSTATE LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellee

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, jj.
parties: Joseph LEE, Jr., Administrator of the Estate of Ethel M. Lee, Appellant, v. ALLSTATE LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellee.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
This appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
PAPADAKOS, J., notes his dissent.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Brett A. Huckabee, Robin S. Levengood, Wyomissing, for appellant.
Bradley D. Miller, Reading, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
600 A.2d 1255
Joseph LEE, Jr., Administrator of the Estate of Ethel M. Lee, Appellant, v. ALLSTATE LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Oct. 24, 1991.
Decided Jan. 17, 1992.
Brett A. Huckabee, Robin S. Levengood, Wyomissing, for appellant.
Bradley D. Miller, Reading, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and CAPPY, jj.
